result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephean A Hoya was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Get GED or HSED.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with any family members.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

Case 14CM1886 was dismissed and read into: 15CF37.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

Proposed Order denying Defendant's request for Huber release
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 4/3/17
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction
1/17/17 Request from DOC to impose condition time
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Stephean A Hoya in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

2 1/2  YEARS IMPRISONMENT
-  1  YEAR INITIAL CONFINEMENT
-  1 1/2 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION
 
TERM OF PROBATION: 2 YEARS
           
CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; Obtain GED/HSED?
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No violent contact with: any family members
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 


COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant

** Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
